name: St. Francis Xavier
summary: Francis Xavier was a Spanish Jesuit missionary who is known as the Apostle to the Indies. He was one of the founding members of the Society of Jesus and worked as a missionary in India, Japan, and other parts of Asia. He was the first Christian missionary to Japan and is credited with establishing Christian communities throughout Asia. He died on the island of Shangchuan while attempting to enter China. He is the patron saint of missionaries and is one of the most important figures in the history of Catholic missions.
